intro: Myoxanthus werneri, commonly known as the Werneri's myoxanthus, is a rare flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Myoxanthaceae and is characterized by its unique, small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are typically ovate to elliptical in shape. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in dense forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
